turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Monsoon (speakers).
turn.2: Monsoon (speakers) Monsoon is a brand of loudspeakers, originally automotive speaker systems and later computer speakers.
turn.4: Monsoon was originally associated with OEM-sourced automotive audio speaker systems, notably supplied on a number of General Motors products and then later expanded onto other manufacturers such as Volkswagen.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The brand name was also licensed to Sonigistix, a Richmond, B.C., Canada company, and applied to their line of computer multimedia speakers.
turn.8: Sonigistix started out as a project out of the UBC Electrical Engineering company and existed for two years on the UBC campus.
turn.10: Its founder was Brent Bolleman and its first "raison d'être" was to refine and market an electrostatic computer product based on the design of Quad Electrostatics.
turn.12: Electrostatic speakers have their own problems due to the need for the membrane requiring high voltage, which is dangerous and has the requirement of a step up transformer, which is costly.
